Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: unclemo
Reviews.Content: Gave it 5 stars because I have no problems so far .Great Laptop if your looking to purchase a Windows 7 before there gone

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire Laptop
Reviews.Author: Deloris G. Rapp
Reviews.Content: The laptop  is excellent, my son advised me in purchasing and stated this is what he would have purchased for himself.  I wanted a lighter weight, however, he said I would have gotten slower startup, less memory.  I am pleased for the money I paid.

Reviews.Title: Great Machine with lots of power and speed
Reviews.Author: Robert l.
Reviews.Content: Powers up fast and handles multiple programs and Web Browsing with ease. Windows 7 platform which is so much more user friendly than windows 8. 8GB ram and a 1 TB hard drive gives it lots of storage space and quick movement through processing and switching amongst programs. Excellent screen. Great for movies and light gaming.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop but......
Reviews.Author: average joe
Reviews.Content: This laptop is great; however, the disk drive has a difficult time opening.  There is a metal piece inside that is bent down and is hitting the sliding tray.  I bent it up to allow the tray to move but it still hits.  I do not want to send it back for this so I will have to live with it.  I wish quality control caught this.

Reviews.Title: All that was promised!
Reviews.Author: Juvakka
Reviews.Content: Blazingly fast i7 Core handles the internet incredibly well. Programs were loaded and files transferred without a hitch.  For $750, a machine this fast is a deal that is hard to beat.  I have used several other computer brands, but I have to say that this is my second Acer, and I have been consistently pleased with Acer products.  With products like this, Acer could seize the lead in the laptop market place.

Reviews.Title: Very fast laptop, works great with Gentoo Linux
Reviews.Author: Blake
Reviews.Content: This machine has a monster CPU, much faster than laptops costing twice as much. All peripherals work well with Linux, and because of  the fast CPU, Gentoo was all compiled and ready to run in just a matter of hours.  Battery life is great, about 4 hours of actual working time.  Plenty of RAM and a huge 1TB hard drive add to the value.  It may not have a lot of extras and gadgets, but that's not what I want in a work computer, just speed.  It would be faster with an SSD, but with the spinning drive it's still plenty fast.  Had the machine a month and it's been great.

Reviews.Title: Appears to be a good machine but can't tell due to lack of parts support
Reviews.Author: PokeyMan
Reviews.Content: Overall I believe this a good machine.  There is a problem that is keeping me from making the recovery disks.  For over 3 weeks Acer has been unable to have the disks made because the software for this machine is so new.  In other words, this machine was put on the market in mid January 2014 and the recovery disks are still not available.  The bad part is that neither customer service nor the parts department are able to tell me why it is taking so long to get the disks.  It appears that they can't talk with engineering to see if there is a technical issue that is trying to be resolved.  Not a good way to start a relationship with a company I haven't done business with before.  At this point I can't recommend this machine to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Returned a Dell for this One.  No "Brushed Aluminum" (Thank You).
Reviews.Author: Charles Knowland
Reviews.Content: This will sound strange to a lot of people, but I bought a Dell and returned it in favor of this one due mainly to one factor; the smooth plastic surface of all things.  The Dell I bought, as with SO many others in its class, has this "brushed aluminum" surface that they neglected to advertise.  I do not want my hand resting against an aluminum alloy for 8 to 12 hours a day.  I am shocked the computer companies would not be conscious of people having health concerns about constant aluminum exposure of any kind.  Only a percentage of people will care, but it's a significant concern among enough people that I'm shocked the manufacturers are using the material.So, I have the smooth plastic surface.  Of course there are concerns with plastic, but not like those of aluminum.  People think the plastic is "cheap" in comparison, but I am plenty happy with it.  It is a smooth clean surface that is easy to maintain.Outside of that, this is my second Acer and I am very happy with it thus far.  Great performance.  A bonus to have no windows 8 to learn...I just started it up and BANG, off I went with anything I needed to do.  My previous Acer had a minor issue with getting the screen saver to work, but it works all the time now anyway, lol, so whatever was going on resolved itself on its own.  Outside of that, only one other minor issue with a tiny on-and-off again noise in the fan, but it's rare.  Acer's seem to be the cheaper computers by most people's perceptions, but they've been good to me, and their site enables you to actually call and speak to a live person, with a phone number readily available.  I've never had need to call them except to have them help me find the model I wanted to buy, but it's nice to see a computer company that has a strong presence online and makes themselves available should I have any issue at all.  Toshiba, for example, considered an amazing computer company, I couldn't find a dang phone number ANYWHERE on their site just to talk to someone about their features.  One gives up searching for a phone number that should be cake to find under a "contact" link/tab after five minutes wasted.Anyway!...Happy so far, and I expect to be for years to come, just as I am with my old Acer of three years.  "Thank you" Acer for using this "cheap plastic" hand rest/surface....some of us out here actually far PREFER this surface over the metal ones, and will base our buying decisions on it.  It's that important to some of us!And "thank you" Amazon for working with me on this issue and allowing the return of the Dell after expressing my concern upon opening the product.  I'm very happy with the new Acer.

Reviews.Title: Has what I need
Reviews.Author: nighthawk
Reviews.Content: This Acer serves my needs well:  start up fast, not to heavy for traveling with, big screen for watching movie, with clear pictures.  For the price, this Acer is perfect for the choice of work and funs for me who is not really really hi tech.

Reviews.Title: Acer V3-571-9612
Reviews.Author: Safmonkey
Reviews.Content: Great computer.  Really fast.  Would have given it five stars but Acer seems to pre-load it with lots of bloatware that are completely useless for the average business needs.Still... I would recommended it for anyone that wants a reasonable priced Windows 7 machine.

Reviews.Title: the power cord gets loose very easily
Reviews.Author: P.Lee
Reviews.Content: i have my laptop next to my bed. i usually sit in bed with the laptop on my lap. But this ridiculous power cord of this laptop always comes off. it's a really bad design. the power cord is situated on the left side so if your adapter is on the right side, and you move your laptop. it just gets unplugged like that. It happens at least 2 times a week. it's just an extremely bad design!!! and I'm writing this just because my power cord just popped out again, turning my entire laptop off.

Reviews.Title: Good workhorse laptop
Reviews.Author: D. E. Biegun
Reviews.Content: While still quite new, this laptop has met our expectations.  The ten key keypad was important to my wife, while I liked the 8 gigs of RAM.

Reviews.Title: Beware the keyboard
Reviews.Author: Corinna Steele
Reviews.Content: I used a temporary 10.5" Toshiba for two years for all my office work.  This new 15.6 keyboard is lovely and large and I find the computer is oh so fast.  But, the keyboard has a mind of its own.  I have checked keyboard shortcuts and other possible reasons for its actions.  I am typing and then I am at the beginning of the sentence or the page and typing over what I was typing.  In emails, this is manifested by my message suddenly being typed in the middle of the subject line, after I am almost finished.  No rhyme or reason, but major annoying.  So, I am looking for solutions.The speed of the connection with the internet and other operations are lovely, but if the keyboard is a problem, it is a huge problem.  I rated okay because of this, with the hope it will be resolved.

Reviews.Title: Not good.
Reviews.Author: Lee Ann Cogert
Reviews.Content: At the time i ordered the computer it had a different description of it on the Acer website which then forwarded me to the Amazon link of purchasing the computer.  It was not the same graphics card as listed on the Acer website for that model.  When i returned the computer and went back to check the description one day later on Acer, the description was changed to reflect the correct information.  But ordering and having to return the computer due to misinformation about the model on the Acer website, was an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: Decent laptop
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: Solid performance especially for the price.. Touchpad is too sensitive and picks up on my hand as I'm typing making some tasks difficult.

Reviews.Title: I am very Disapppointed
Reviews.Author: William J. Gies II "Bill"
Reviews.Content: The Acer is a slick looking machine, but for whatever reason it is "jumpy'"  By this I mean that I will be typing along and suddenly all that I have typed is erased.  To compensate for this problem, when I write anything, I tend to do so as an E-Doc so I can use the "Mail Waiting to be Sent" option to capture each and every paragraph as I write it.  I am not an accomplished computer person, but I have never experienced such a problem on the other computres I have owned. If I can't figure out what s causing the problem, I will be forced to abandon this machine and eat the $$s spent on it.  Not a very happy situation.

Reviews.Title: Perfect, love love love it!
Reviews.Author: J. Symonds "jsymonds"
Reviews.Content: Absolutely AMAZING computer, runs like a charm, shipped super fast, really overall pleased. :D(Also, plays World of Warcraft like a pro!)

Reviews.Title: Enthusiastically recommend!
Reviews.Author: Rich
Reviews.Content: I owned an ACER laptop for 8 years.  It always worked well but was limited with only 80GB HD and 1GB Ram.  The 9612 has 1000GB HD with 8GB Ram.  After a short setup, make sure you know your router's security key, it booted up instantly.  Been running perfectly since.  It is the quietest computer I've ever used.  Touch pad is excellent.  Windows 7 was the right choice.  McAfee's shredder is a nice feature but I heard disturbing things about McAfee so I bought Kapersky pure 3.0.  The DVD burner works like a dream.  The 9612 looks beautiful and the color contrast of the key board enhances key location.  I can enthusiastically recommend the Aspire V3-571-9612!

Reviews.Title: Hate the keyboard.
Reviews.Author: Ludmila
Reviews.Content: Because of its light weight, the keyboard is flimsy - the key buttons are not raised high and "delete" button gets stock from day one. Otherwise - no problem.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop with limited battery but good performance
Reviews.Author: Josh Tucker
Reviews.Content: Good laptop. Battery life not great but I'm paying for the chip performance not the energy usage so I'm pleased.
